findings.label: Paid During Active Breaches
findings.detail: 21 suppliers received payments while in breach of Companies Act — including entities with no active directors or facing strike-off. Verified against Companies House records.

findings.label: Missing Transaction Descriptions
findings.detail: None of the 30,580 spending records include a description of what was purchased — the worst transparency gap of any East Lancashire council

findings.label: Suspected Split Payments
findings.detail: 602 instances of 3+ payments just below approval thresholds in the same week — may indicate circumvention of procurement rules

findings.label: Missing Department Data
findings.detail: 4,044 transactions (13.2%) have no department assigned — makes it impossible to track which services are spending

findings.label: March Spending Premium
findings.detail: March spending averages 1.4x the monthly average (£8.5M vs £6M). A mild year-end pattern — October is actually the highest month (£9.5M avg)

key_findings.title: Molesworth Hotel Ltd: £59.1K paid during active breach
key_findings.description: No active directors; No person with significant control registered. Council paid this company despite Companies House non-compliance.

key_findings.title: JML Property Solutions Ltd: £48.0K paid during active breach
key_findings.description: Company facing strike-off proceedings. Filed dormant accounts but receiving council payments.

key_findings.title: Zero descriptions: every transaction is opaque
key_findings.description: Burnley publishes supplier names and amounts but never describes what was purchased. Hyndburn and Pendle both include descriptions for every payment.

key_findings.title: URBASER LTD: 959 transactions totalling £19.5M
key_findings.description: Averaging £20.3K per transaction — the council's most frequent supplier. Waste collection contract.

key_findings.title: 39 suppliers shared with neighbouring councils — £100.3M total
key_findings.description: Compare what each council pays the same suppliers for similar services.

key_findings.title: WALTON SUMMIT TRUCK CENTRE LTD: very different service scopes
key_findings.description: Burnley pays £56K avg per transaction vs Pendle £49 — likely reflects vehicle purchases vs parts/servicing, not price gouging.
